page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN LINTON
page.content: Those people who we have interviewed thought that there was a great need in Linton for a car park.Everybody thought that the bus service was adequate for their needs.People thought that there was an advantage in having a car in Linton.More people owned a car than any other vehicle;about 10% of them own 2 cars.It appears to us that the yellow lines in Linton are controversial.The A604 is always busy,nearly everybody in Linton uses it frequently to get to work and shops etc.The roads are usually blocked up.The busiest place in Linton is at the infant school during the mornings and afternoons. People seem to walk only a short distance mainly to the shops. By:M.South,T.Roffey,C.Lambert,S.Potter J.Hughes and S.Hockett.
